{"step_by_step_thinking": "Norepinephrine is a vasopressor used in the treatment of septic shock. According to the documents, it works by increasing the mean arterial pressure and systemic vascular resistance. It does not typically affect heart rate significantly. It also does not decrease renal perfusion or reduce urine output. In fact, some documents suggest that it may improve renal function and increase urine output.", "answer_choice": "C"}
